concept.deftn: An indication as to whether the resource is refereed or non-refereed.

outline.deftn: the resource was subjected to critical evaluation by one or more experts in the field to determine the originality and quality of the research and whether the subject falls within the scope of the publication

the resource was not subjected to critical evaluation by one or more experts in the field to determine the originality and quality of the research and whether the subject falls within the scope of the publication

bestPractices.practice: Books, book chapters, book forewords, book reviews, and technical notes are not refereed.
Presentations and posters are not refereed.
Most proceedings are non-refereed. If they are refereed, it is generally very clearly stated on the event or sponsor's website.
If you need help determining whether or not a resource is refereed, contact the OpenSky staff at opensky@ucar.edu.
